Burundi - Projet de developpement rural
            du kirimiro

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            (PCR) for the Kirimiro Rural Development Project. The
            project aimed at: (a) assisting smallholders to improve the
            productivity of their holdings, and thereby increase their
            food consumption and income, through the provision of
            inputs, the strengthening of extension services and the
            implementation of appropriate erosion control measures; (b)
            improving rural living conditions by building of maintaining
            water sources, equipping social centers and developing wood
            resources to be used as fuel wood, building poles and
            timber; and (c) improving the quality of Burundi coffee by
            building washing stations. The project signaled a change
            from the Government's previous agricultural development
            strategy. Instead of centralized governmental departments
            being used to develop coffee production, Regional
            Development Companies (RDCs) were to be created as
            decentralized agencies, to be made responsible for the
            integrated development of their respective regions
            (foodcrops, coffee, infrastructure, erosion control). One
            RDC was therefore set up under this project to carry out the
            activities that had previously been the responsibility of
            separate departments.
